page.title: 13SUMMER FAIR
page.content: Our usual P.T.A. Summer Fair was held on the evening of the first Friday in July.The theme this year was 'Clowns'. Rev.Dawes,the Methodist Minister,opened the Fair and was presented with a buttonhole and a bouquet for his wife.His first task was to judge the very good turn out of clowns.The fun continued with stalls,sideshows and competitions.Mark and Anthony were the targets for custard pies and took turns to stand in a pillory.The most popular event for children was the pillow fight, where opponents do their best to knock each other off a bar with pillows. Entertainment was provided by{Bodmin {Junior Band}and the"{Offchants}".Hot dogs,hamburgers and onions were sold out.A great evening finished with sheaf tossing.Nearly all the village came.My Mum chatted with everyone.
